segment.source: This section provides information on creating Universal Windows app that capture, playback, or edit photos, videos, or audio.
segment.target: This section provides information on creating Universal Windows app that capture, playback, or edit photos, videos, or audio.

segment.source: Audio, video, and camera
segment.target: Audio, video, and camera

segment.source: Audio, video, and camera
segment.target: Audio, video, and camera

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: This section provides information on creating Universal Windows app that capture, playback, or edit photos, videos, or audio.
segment.target: This section provides information on creating Universal Windows app that capture, playback, or edit photos, videos, or audio.

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Capture photos and video with CameraCaptureUI
segment.target: Capture photos and video with CameraCaptureUI

segment.source: This article describes how to use the CameraCaptureUI class to capture photos or videos using the camera UI built into Windows.
segment.target: This article describes how to use the CameraCaptureUI class to capture photos or videos using the camera UI built into Windows.

segment.source: Capture photos and video with MediaCapture
segment.target: Capture photos and video with MediaCapture

segment.source: This article describes the steps for capturing photos and video using the MediaCapture API, including initializing and shutting down the MediaCapture and handling changes in device orientation.
segment.target: This article describes the steps for capturing photos and video using the MediaCapture API, including initializing and shutting down the MediaCapture and handling changes in device orientation.

segment.source: Detect faces in images or videos
segment.target: Detect faces in images or videos

segment.source: This topic shows how to use the FaceTracker is optimized for tracking faces over time in a sequence of video frames.
segment.target: This topic shows how to use the FaceTracker is optimized for tracking faces over time in a sequence of video frames.

segment.source: Media compositions and editing
segment.target: Media compositions and editing

segment.source: The APIs in the Microsoft Media Foundation API.
segment.target: The APIs in the Microsoft Media Foundation API.

segment.source: Imaging
segment.target: Imaging

segment.source: This article explains how to load and save image files using SoftwareBitmap object to represent bitmap images.
segment.target: This article explains how to load and save image files using SoftwareBitmap object to represent bitmap images.

segment.source: Transcode media files
segment.target: Transcode media files

segment.source: You can use the Windows.Media.Transcoding APIs to transcode video files from one format to another.
segment.target: You can use the Windows.Media.Transcoding APIs to transcode video files from one format to another.

segment.source: Process media files in the background
segment.target: Process media files in the background

segment.source: This article shows you how to use the MediaProcessingTrigger and a background task to process media files in the background.
segment.target: This article shows you how to use the MediaProcessingTrigger and a background task to process media files in the background.

segment.source: Media playback with MediaSource
segment.target: Media playback with MediaSource

segment.source: The MediaSource class provides a common way to reference and play back media from different sources such as local or remote files and exposes a common model for accessing media data, regardless of the underlying media format.
segment.target: The MediaSource class provides a common way to reference and play back media from different sources such as local or remote files and exposes a common model for accessing media data, regardless of the underlying media format.

segment.source: Adaptive Streaming
segment.target: Adaptive Streaming

segment.source: This article describes how to add playback of adaptive streaming multimedia content to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
segment.target: This article describes how to add playback of adaptive streaming multimedia content to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

segment.source: This feature currently supports playback of Http Live Streaming (HLS) and Dynamic Streaming over HTTP (DASH) content.
segment.target: This feature currently supports playback of Http Live Streaming (HLS) and Dynamic Streaming over HTTP (DASH) content.

segment.source: Background Audio
segment.target: Background Audio

segment.source: This article describes how to create UWP apps that play audio in the background.
segment.target: This article describes how to create UWP apps that play audio in the background.

segment.source: System Media Transport Controls
segment.target: System Media Transport Controls

segment.source: The SystemMediaTransportControls class enables your app to use the system media transport controls that are built into Windows and to update the metadata that the controls display about the media your app is currently playing.
segment.target: The SystemMediaTransportControls class enables your app to use the system media transport controls that are built into Windows and to update the metadata that the controls display about the media your app is currently playing.

segment.source: Media casting
segment.target: Media casting

segment.source: This article shows you how to cast media to remote devices from a Universal Windows app.
segment.target: This article shows you how to cast media to remote devices from a Universal Windows app.

segment.source: Audio Graphs
segment.target: Audio Graphs

segment.source: This article shows how to use the APIs in the Windows.Media.Audio namespace to create audio graphs for audio routing, mixing, and processing scenarios.
segment.target: This article shows how to use the APIs in the Windows.Media.Audio namespace to create audio graphs for audio routing, mixing, and processing scenarios.

segment.source: MIDI
segment.target: MIDI

segment.source: This article shows you how to enumerate MIDI (Musical Instrument Digital Interface) devices and send and receive MIDI messages from a Universal Windows app.
segment.target: This article shows you how to enumerate MIDI (Musical Instrument Digital Interface) devices and send and receive MIDI messages from a Universal Windows app.

segment.source: Camera-independent Flashlight
segment.target: Camera-independent Flashlight

segment.source: This article shows how to access and use a device's lamp, if one is present.
segment.target: This article shows how to access and use a device's lamp, if one is present.

segment.source: Lamp functionality is managed separately from the device's camera and camera flash functionality.
segment.target: Lamp functionality is managed separately from the device's camera and camera flash functionality.

segment.source: Supported codecs
segment.target: Supported codecs

segment.source: This article lists the audio and video codec and format support for UWP apps.
segment.target: This article lists the audio and video codec and format support for UWP apps.

segment.source: PlayReady DRM
segment.target: PlayReady DRM

segment.source: This topic describes how to add PlayReady protected media content to your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.
segment.target: This topic describes how to add PlayReady protected media content to your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.

segment.source: PlayReady Encrypted Media Extension
segment.target: PlayReady Encrypted Media Extension

segment.source: This section describes how to modify your PlayReady Web app to support the changes made from the previous Windows 8.1 version to the Windows 10 version.
segment.target: This section describes how to modify your PlayReady Web app to support the changes made from the previous Windows 8.1 version to the Windows 10 version.
